name: Chicago
fun_fact: Fun fact: Putting ketchup on a Chicago-style hot dog is considered a sin so serious that locals will actually glare at youâ€”the city takes its mustard-only rule more seriously than some people take their religion.

hero_dishes.name: Deep Dish Pizza at Lou Malnati's
hero_dishes.description: Thick, buttery crust filled with layers of mozzarella, toppings, and chunky tomato sauce on topâ€”a pizza that requires a fork and knife
hero_dishes.origin_story: Lou Malnati's has been making butter-crust deep dish since 1971 using a family recipe. The Malnati family actually invented deep dish at Pizzeria Uno in 1943, making this pizza royalty. The signature butter crust adds richness that regular dough can't match
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Lou Malnati's (multiple locations), Gino's East (graffiti-covered walls since 1966), or Pequod's (caramelized cheese edges)

hero_dishes.name: Italian Beef at Al's Italian Beef
hero_dishes.description: Thinly sliced seasoned roast beef piled on an Italian roll, dipped in meat juices, topped with giardiniera or sweet peppers
hero_dishes.origin_story: Born in an Italian butcher shop on the South Side in the 1930s, based on the French Dip. Al's has been the king of Italian beef since 1938, perfecting the 'dipped' technique where the entire sandwich gets dunked in au jus
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Al's Italian Beef (multiple locations) or Portillo's (the iconic fast-food empire that started as a hot dog trailer in 1963)

hero_dishes.name: Chicago-Style Hot Dog at Superdawg
hero_dishes.description: All-beef hot dog on a poppy seed bun with mustard, raw onions, neon green relish, tomato slices, pickle spear, sport peppers, and celery saltâ€”no ketchup allowed
hero_dishes.origin_story: Superdawg's giant hot dog mascots have stood on the roof since 1948, serving carhops in retro uniforms. The dog comes in a box decorated with Maurie and Flaurie, the mascot couple. This is Chicago food nostalgia at its purest
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Superdawg (Northwest Side drive-in since 1948) or Redhot Ranch for minimalist authenticity

hero_dishes.name: Italian Beef Deep Dish Pizza (Lou Malnati's x Portillo's)
hero_dishes.description: The ultimate Chicago mash-up: Lou Malnati's deep dish crust filled with Portillo's Italian beef, giardiniera, and mozzarella
hero_dishes.origin_story: In 2024, two Chicago icons teamed up for Italian Beef Week, creating a pizza that combines both legendary dishes. It's excessive, ridiculous, and perfectly Chicago
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Lou Malnati's during special collaborations (check for Italian Beef Week in May)

signature_drinks.name: Old Style Beer
signature_drinks.description: Chicago's working-class lagerâ€”crisp, clean, and inseparable from Cubs games and neighborhood bars
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Ice-cold at Wrigleyville bars during Cubs games, or with Italian beef at corner taverns. The Old Style sign is as iconic as the Chicago skyline
